TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SoapMethodAttribute extends System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapAttribute

Docs.summary: Customizes SOAP generation and processing for a method. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The target objects for the SoapMethodAttribute attribute are methods that can be remotely invoked. Apply the SoapMethodAttribute to customize SOAP generation and processing. Properties of this attribute allow the programmer to customize the SOAPAction HTTP header field to indicate the intent of the SOAP HTTP request.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the members in the SoapMethodAttribute class to customize SOAP generation and processing for a method.
[!code-cpp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapMethodAttribute#100](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.runtime.remotin_21_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapMethodAttribute#100](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.runtime.remotin_21_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the XML element name to use for the method response to the target method.
Docs.value: The XML element name to use for the method response to the target method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value of this property is the string "Response" appended to the name of the method.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the ResponseXmlElementName property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapMethodAttribute> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapMethodAttribute#110](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.runtime.remotin_16_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapMethodAttribute#110](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.runtime.remotin_16_1.cs)]

Docs.value: The XML element namesapce used for method response to the target method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the XML element name used for the return value from the target method.
Docs.value: The XML element name used for the return value from the target method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value of this property is the "__return" string.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the ReturnXmlElementName property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapMethodAttribute> class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the SOAPAction header field used with HTTP requests sent with this method. This property is currently not implemented.
Docs.value: The SOAPAction header field used with HTTP requests sent with this method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is currently not implemented.
The SOAPAction HTTP request header field indicates the intent of the SOAP HTTP request. For more information on the SOAPAction field, see www.w3.org/tr/soap/#_Toc478383528.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the SoapAction property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapMethodAttribute> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapMethodAttribute#110](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.runtime.remotin_44_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapMethodAttribute#110](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.runtime.remotin_44_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool UseAttribute { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the target of the current attribute will be serialized as an XML attribute instead of an XML field.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapTypeAttribute.UseAttribute%2A> property cannot be set on the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapMethodAttribute> attribute.

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to set the current property.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string XmlNamespace { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the XML namespace that is used during serialization of remote method calls of the target method.
Docs.value: The XML namespace that is used during serialization of remote method calls of the target method.
